thread.title: There's growing concern Steelers' Martavis Bryant won't play vs. San Diego
thread.title_full: There's growing concern Steelers' Martavis Bryant won't play vs. San Diego

author: jordan.heck@performgroup.com (Jordan Heck)
title: There's growing concern Steelers' Martavis Bryant won't play vs. San Diego
text:
There's growing concern Steelers' Martavis Bryant won't play vs. San Diego Sporting News 7 hrs ago jordan.heck@performgroup.com (Jordan Heck) Steelers receiver Martavis Bryant returns from his four-game suspension this week, but there's some concern whether he'll actually play.
AdChoices He has not been activated on the official 53-man roster, so the Steelers don't have to place him on their daily practice/injury report. The team doesn't have to put him on the 53-man roster until 4 p.m. Monday and coach Mike Tomlin joked he wouldn't make a decision until about 3:58.
MORE: Top 10 Steelers of all time | Week 5 picks
The media isn't allowed to report which players practice based on their observation, per Steelers policy. But Bryant told reporters Wednesday he did not practice. When the team was asked about his practice participation Thursday, a spokesperson wouldn't clarify.
While the Steelers are keeping quiet about Bryant's practice participation, Michael Vick apparently let the cat out of the bag. He told Pittsburgh reporter Mike Prisuta he's only practiced with Bryant once this week, and that was Monday. He also added he's "getting a little concerned" about Bryant's availability.
"Just gotta keep the faith, hopefully he'll get himself back," he said .
For regular fans it won't matter much whether Bryant plays, but for fantasy football owners this is a nightmare scenario. Bryant exploded last season with his eight touchdown receptions in 10 games and was expected to be a major factor this season once his suspension lifted.
If Bryant does play, he'd be a huge addition for Vick, who is filling in for an injured Ben Roethlisberger. The pair worked well together in the preseason when Vick's first pass as a Steeler went for 63 yards to Bryant against the Bills. He ended with two passes for 99 yards from Vick in that game.
